name: Pseudomonic Functor
definition: A **Functor** $F:C\to D$ is **pseudomonic** if it is faithful (injective on hom-sets) and full on isomorphisms: for any objects $x, y$ in $C$, the map $F: \mathrm{Iso}_C(x, y) \to \mathrm{Iso}_D(Fx, Fy)$ is bijective.
description: A #functor is pseudomonic if it is faithful and full on isomorphisms.
